column4: Can somebody please help me?  I'm very frustrated at this point.
Why is it do difficult to install Flash?  I've tried multiple methods and none of them work.
sudo aptitude install flashplugin-nonfree allways worked for me
Couldn't find any package whose name or description matched "flashplugin-nonfree"
maybe you do not have multiverse enabled ? Go to System>Admin>Software sources
in the first tab tick the multiverse repo
Why is it such a difficult task?  Why can't I just go to Adobe's website and download it, then the installer actually works?  Or why can't Firefox do it on its own?
legal issues; copyright; software patents and all that s**t makes this things complicated in a free as in freedom world
you pay nothing for the OS you have to jump some hoops; the package to read comercial DVD can not even bee in multiverse it has to be in its own repo outside the USA
which is BTW the country that makes this things so sh**ty
Apparently I had to update something.
Now it works in Ubuntu Software Center
But it didn't before, which makes no sense.
Oh well, I got it.  Bye.
after enabling multiverse install the ubuntu-restricted-extras package that package instals flash java mp3 support and a bunch of other video codecs and stuff
